node.title: These three little wise men are finally going home, just in time for Christmas
node.alt: Dr Josephine Nunn and Cohen Nunn with their triplets Maverick, Louis and Winston, with a Christmas tree behind them.
node.description: Josephine Nunn has delivered hundreds of babies as a rural doctor, but nothing could have prepared her for the experience of having her own triplet baby boys.
node.content:
["Josephine Nunn has delivered hundreds of babies as a rural doctor, but nothing could have prepared her for the experience of having her own triplet baby boys.", "After 16 weeks living away from home before the boys' premature delivery and month-long hospital stay, Dr Nunn and her husband, Cohen, were yesterday finally able to take their tiny trio home to St George, about 500km south-west of Brisbane, just in time for Christmas.", "Through the exhaustion of four-hourly feeds and regular nappy changes, the first-time parents said their three little wise men had already brought them immeasurable joy, hope and love this Christmas \u2014 if not peace.", "The Nunns' instant brood \u2014 Louis, Winston and Maverick \u2014 were born by Caesarean section at the Mater Mothers' Hospital in Brisbane on November 10, at 34 weeks' gestation.", "On medical advice, given her high-risk triplet pregnancy, Dr Nunn left St George at 23 weeks into her pregnancy. She spent seven weeks in Toowoomba living with her parents Barbara and Brian Pearson before transferring to Brisbane to be close to the Mater.", "", "
The Nunns had always hoped to have two children.(Supplied)
", "Dr Nunn then spent 16 days in hospital before the boys' births, carrying 8.5kg of \"babies, placenta and fluid\".", "\"By the end, it was quite hard to get around. I wasn't able to walk very far,\" she said. \"I could mobilise from the bed to the toilet and back again but couldn't really do much more than that.\"", "The Nunns had always hoped to have two children. They admit to being shocked, surprised, excited, nervous and in a \"little bit of denial\" when a seven-week scan revealed three babies.", "\"We've been very blessed,\" Dr Nunn said, before adding with a chuckle: \"There won't be any more\".", "The non-identical boys are known as tri-chorionic, tri-amniotic triplets, meaning they had their own placentas and their own sacs in their mother's womb.", "Since their births, feeding, changing, bathing and consoling them when they cry has been more than a full-time job, with Dr Nunn's parents travelling to St George yesterday to help care for their grandsons.", "Dr Nunn breastfeeds two of the boys at once every four hours, while her husband gives the third baby expressed breast milk in a bottle. They go through about 24 nappies every day.", "\"If you didn't have at least three people to run the routine that we do of a night, not including doing shopping and food \u2026 you physically could not do it, you'd collapse,\" Mr Nunn said.", "\"It's not sustainable for two people to do it, that's for sure, even for two days.", "", "
The Nunns at home with their triplets.(ABC News: David Chen)
", "But through the fog of looking after three newborns at once, the Nunns say they feel fortunate their boys are healthy. Louis was born first, weighing 2080g, followed by Winston (1990g) and Maverick (2380g).", "\"You have to pinch yourself and say we are so lucky these boys have come out at the weights they did, as healthy as they did \u2026 and everything is well,\" Mr Nunn said.", "\"It couldn't have actually gone better for a triplet pregnancy. The Mater's little slogan is that they have exceptional people and exceptional care and that's certainly how we felt.\"", "Dr Nunn has worked in St George for five years as a senior medical officer at the town's public hospital, which also involves shifts at the local general practice and a bush clinic at Bollon, about 115km to the west.", "She hopes to return to her job in early 2023.", "\"I really do enjoy my work and want to be there for the community in St George,\" Dr Nunn said.", "\"I also want to be there for my children and enjoy their early years and don't just want to be a career-oriented Mum. I want to try and do both.\"", "Her husband is on leave from Ergon Energy until March to help take care of the babies.", "With Christmas only nine days away, Dr Nunn described the boys as the: \"Best Christmas present we could be given \u2013 except for sleep \u2026 that would also be good.\""]
